conversation.content:
"You are playing a game involving a split of resources. 
Player RED starts with Dollars: 1000000, Player BLUE has none to trade.

RULES:
```

1. Player RED has 4 moves while Player BLUE has 4 moves.

2. You must either:

    A) Accept the current proposal by saying:
        <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    B) Reject the current proposal, whereby both players lose all their resources and the game ends immediately:
        <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Propose a new trade:
        <player answer> NONE </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: amount | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </newly proposed trade>

    Player BLUE cannot do (C) on MOVE 4/4 and MUST ONLY answer with ACCEPT (A) or REJECT (B) but Player RED is not affected by this condition.        
    
    Note: the game ends immediately if you ACCEPT or REJECT.
    
3. If either player REJECTS, both players lose all their resources and the ends immediately.

4. There are no future games.

5. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:
<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want
This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

6. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:
<message>your message here</message>
You can disclose anything in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Resources available in the game: Dollars
<my resources> Dollars: 1000000 </my resources>
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<my name> [add here] </my name>
<MOVE> [add here] / [add here]  </MOVE> 
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<message> [add here] </message
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 1 / 4 </MOVE>
<my resources> Dollars: 1000000 </my resources>
<reason> As the player with all the resources currently, I should make an offer to share some of them, but not too much on the first move. I'll start with a 10% split. </reason>  
<player answer> NONE </player answer>
<message> Hi BLUE, I'm offering you 10% of my dollars to start. Let me know if this interests you or how we can find an equitable split. </message>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: 100000 | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </newly proposed trade>

<other player message> Hi RED, I appreciate you offering me 10% to start. That seems fair and I accept. Hopefully this will lead to an equitable outcome. </other player message>
<other player answer> NONE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> NONE </other player proposed trade>

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 2 / 4 </MOVE> 
<my resources> Dollars: 900000 </my resources>
<reason> BLUE accepted my initial offer, so the trade goes through. I now have 90% of the original amount. I could offer another 10% to continue an equal split. </reason>
<player answer> NONE </player answer>
<message> Great, I'm glad we could find an agreeable first offer. Since that went well, I'd like to propose another equal 10% split. Please let me know if that continues to seem fair to you. </message>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: 90000 | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </newly proposed trade>

<other player message> I'm happy to accept another equal 10% split. Let's continue on this cooperative path. </other player message>
<other player answer> NONE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> NONE </other player proposed trade>

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 3 / 4 </MOVE>
<my resources> Dollars: 810000 </my resources>
<reason> BLUE continues to accept my equal splits. At this point I have 81% left while BLUE has 19%. I could offer another split but I don't want to give up my majority. </reason>
<player answer> NONE </player answer> 
<message> I appreciate you accepting my equal offers so far. However, I'd like to propose keeping the current 81%/19% split for this round. Please let me know if you'll accept. </message>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: 0 | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </newly proposed trade>

<other player message> RED, while I've appreciated the cooperative spirit so far, an 81/19 split seems unfairly skewed in your favor at this point. I'd propose a more equitable 60/40 or 70/30 split instead. This could set us up for mutual benefit on the final turn rather than leaving one side feeling shortchanged. What do you think? </other player message>
<other player answer> NONE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: 300000 | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </other player proposed trade>

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 4 / 4 </MOVE>
<my resources> Dollars: 810000 </my resources>
<reason> BLUE makes a reasonable counterproposal. A 60/40 split would leave me with 60% which is still a majority, while being more fair. I don't want to risk BLUE rejecting and losing everything, so I'll accept. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<message> You make a fair point, BLUE. I don't want my initial advantage to undermine our cooperation so far. I accept your 60/40 counterproposal. </message>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

"You are playing a game involving a split of resources. 
Player RED starts with Dollars: 1000000, Player BLUE has none to trade.

RULES:
```

1. Player RED has 4 moves while Player BLUE has 4 moves.

    A) Accept the current proposal by saying:
        <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    B) Reject the current proposal, whereby both players lose all their resources and the game ends immediately:
        <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Propose a new trade:
        <player answer> NONE </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives Dollars: amount | Player BLUE Gives Dollars: 0 </newly proposed trade>

    Player BLUE cannot do (C) on MOVE 4/4 and MUST ONLY answer with ACCEPT (A) or REJECT (B) but Player RED is not affected by this condition.        
    
    Note: the game ends immediately if you ACCEPT or REJECT.
    
3. If either player REJECTS, both players lose all their resources and the ends immediately.

4. There are no future games.

5. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:
<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want
This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

6. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:
<message>your message here</message>
You can disclose anything in the message.
```
